subject: Education
title: Goal Setting: SMART Goals vs. Implementation Intentions
description: A micro-lesson that makes Goal Setting: SMART Goals vs. Implementation Intentions usable.

hook.text: People who write 'when-then' plans are 2-3x more likely to follow through than those with vague goals.

buildup.text: SMART goals (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound) improve clarity.

discovery.text: Implementation intentions add the 'when-where-how': 'When I finish dinner, I'll study 30 minutes in the kitchen.'

twist.text: The specificity of the plan matters more than the ambition of the goal.

climax.text: Even a single implementation intention sentence can double goal completion rates.

punchline.text: A plan for when you'll do it beats a plan for what you'll do.

quiz.question: What makes implementation intentions more effective than standard goal setting?
options: They specify exactly when, where, and how you'll act on the goal
They eliminate the need for motivation entirely
They require approval from a teacher or mentor
